column4: Hi, if I install lts. Can I switch easily to "normal" ubuntu later ? Will I just need to change the repositories if I decide I want to upgrade in october ?
you can upgrade to 12.10 when it is released in October if you want..yes
ubuntu and ubuntu lts are the same (at install time) ?
the packages are more stable on purpose in LTS, the apps as seen by the lay user will be the same
Are there two different isos for 12.04 if so, are packages more stable in lts or are apps the same ?
the apps varied depending on if you use kubuntu, lubuntu, xubuntu or ubuntu. they will all be officially stable
am I assured the versions of underlying libraries are the same between all flavors (ie: same version of sqlite, gtk) or could they be differents ?
yes that will be identical, just the default DE and apps will differ
and obviously you can run the gnome apps in KDE and vice-versa
then use the startup application in dash and make a startup item to run the command )
are tehre any bugs reported for it?
didn't find a bug bug report, but direct rendering does not work, and I wonder if that's because of that
